522.desc: Very subjective but a decent place for the motivated
522.pros: * You can stretch and take up more than you can chew. In the process, you get to work with some amazing talented folks, learn from them and grow in your career* Managers are usually nice and listen / act on your concerns. However, you may not see results because eventually US is calling the shots* Get to work on scale: If you haven't built anything for scale in your career yet, this might be the place to get a good start before moving on to bigger brands like PayPal, FAANG, etc. Not all products have to deal with scale, but there are enough.* Walmart in India is a good brand name to have on your resume. You will get calls from other tier 1 companies trying to poach you

710.desc: Thinking of interviewing/joining Walmart India ? Read on.

No amount of hike can justify the low quality work being done. Everything told to you about employee friendly, atleast in India, is superficial.

847.desc: I like the work life Balance
847.pros: The title is pretty appropriate, I love the work-life balance. I'm able to hop off of work at 5 (sometimes even earlier), starting at 10. With devs, its always about productivity, if a task takes you 2-3 hours and another dev with same YOE does it in significantly less, then its on you. I had a manager who made it really hard to convert from contractor to FTE though, but once I found a FTE role that I got an offer for, I am really happy with the role and the manager.Really miss my old team though. 881.desc: So much has changed at Walmart this past year.
881.pros: Never had an issue where anyone bothered me while on PTO. You get to work with some very kind and helpful people. Still uncertain how remote vs in-person work expectations will play out. I've never received a phone call from my boss after hours (6pm or later) but know for sure that others have. People are the best part of the job. Couldn't ask for a better culture, and work was much more enjoyable in-person than virtual. You will learn more here than most other retailers due to the size of our ecomm and B&M and your ability to take action in both businesses.
881.cons: Low comp vs rest of industry. Walmart can be very bureaucratic, which probably surprises no one. Promotions come slowly, as Walmart has some very dated rules about time-in-chair requirements (three years) for Merchants at all levels. We re-organized in 2020 and have ave seen remarkably high attrition as the ecomm and store organizations were merged. Many ecomm people left rather than move to Bentonville, and our ability to manage that side of the business has suffered dramatically. Work loads have also increased dramatically and are part of the reason the high attrition continues. Our tech tools are buggy and inhibit ability to do our job. Management talks about being responsive to our needs but so far, very little at all has changed. Hardest part of the job is keeping up with all the things we are now responsible for, post-reorganization. We used to have tema of 8-9 managing ecomm, and 1-2 managing B&M. No we have 2-5 managing both. Doesn't make sense.
881.authorInfo: Verified User Current Employee  B*****  Merchant - May 11, 2021

992.desc: Work in application support (CSII) at Walmart
992.pros: Work was good when we had vendor partners. We were able to focus on fixing and improving our apps while coming up with new solutions. However, post Suresh Kumar (our new CTO for the last year), life has changed drastically where we are now providing level 1 support to our applications which are running on EOL hardware. No pros at all if working in operations. I am a software engineer 3 with master's degree doing night shifts and providing level 1 support to apps that do not belong to my skillset.
992.cons: MICRO MANAGED, STRESSED AND UNDER APPRECIATED. these are the three words to describe the work in our area (CSII - Core Services - Item and Inventory). We are forced to work on applications which are not part of our skillset. I am supporting mainframe apps and my skillset is front end and java. I am expected to pull a rabbit out of my a*s every day. Despite doing all the bloody work, people in my team are getting fired and I get communication that I need to deliver more. Extremely stressful and underappreciated.Skip this area if you have other options.

1056.desc: One of the nicest places to work in bangalore
1056.pros: Offers great work life balance, flexibility to choose your own timings etc based on the  team you are part of.Awesome colleagues and so far have seen an open and accomodative culture across geographies.Benefits and compensation are great and they do have decent annual hikes. Ample opportunity to have your input inserted in the roadmap if found good . Oppurtunity to pick up a lot great technologies as they are going through a tech modernization bid. Additionally there is no role/level based discrimination and they are quick to reward (mostly in cash) as well as provide relevant feedback atleast in my team.this last bit is probably purely based on your manager & the org leads and mine so far seems great.
1056.cons: It was rather confusing last year with regards to delivery expectation etc owing to idc being newly setup for some of our teams ..tooling work was largely adhoc in nature with bulk of them clustered towards the latter half of the year owing  to walmart ecom scale related concerns mostly being holiday centric . This pointed to not having a defined roadmap early on. On the positive side, they do take aes survey results very seriously atleast in my organization and are open to feed back . This year so far has been great especially since they revamped how we plan for the year ahead and has come up with a defined roadmap.

Similar as #2, big insulation from next level manager/s and beyond. I have not any ideas about what standing a manager in my line has with their manager. A lot of game of telephone?4. Continuing the themes, politics within area and across business are not transparent. Politics are expected at a company of the size, the valuation but politics remain hidden. Some may prefer things that way?5. Dead weight is celebrated for causes of diversity, disagreeable weight is cut for causes of a big happy family. It seems to easy to release very smart mildly aggressive 5-10 year staff, but no 20 year staff feeling pressures seemingly, especially meaning diversity groups in US. 6. Based in the southern United States. Work remotely after COVID, but hard to communicate well. Work at HQ and you're in an area not like other parts of the US. If you are from the Southern area then maybe this is Pro7. The company have expectation of living the company attitude, put on your happy face, assertiveness can easily take an appearance of aggression or politically incorrectness. This is specific to your personality, if it feels ok to lose an argument when right, then it won't be so bad for you.These cons, many are easy understandable. Because, risk aversion, for a very large company in the stock market is what is normal. So taking this to mind with a grain of salt!Long list of cons, but this job is for me for now and I don't feel upset at any peer, supervisor, subordinate, etc. Hard to get mad at this company.
